channel.title: [718]Money Pouch Trading Method
channel.description:
hello,
i am playing around with the rune-evo v3 source for something to do in my spare time and i m struggling to find a fi for the money pouch. the money pouch works near perfectly apart from when you are trading you cannot click "+ money pouch", it does nothing meaning you have to have the money in your inventory. just woundering if there is a fix for this anyway. ive tried google for the past few houres but havnt found a fix for this.
thanks

item.title: [718]Money Pouch Trading Method
item.dc:creator: @qtst35 qtst35
item.description:
@qtst35 wrote:

[quote=“BrandonRSPS, post:2, topic:543814”]I wouldn’t really know the actual code for this, here’s my explanation:

Open an interface which allows the input of numbers, like the “x” feature when banking etc, make the result add in money from the money pouch by looking at how the money pouch is used, e.g:
p.moneyPouch
Then make a check to see if the player has entered an amount higher than what he actually has, so something like this:

if(enteredamount >= p.moneyPouch)
       enteredamount = p.moneyPouch;

I’m not sure if it works like that though, would need someone good like sk8rdude461 to explain it in greater detail.[/quote]

Thanks for replying, i kind of understand what you are getting at. i will have a play around and see what i can come up with but im not very good at improvising :).

thank you very much for the help also. still need an answer if anybody knows one but ill have a go at ^ for now

Read full topic

item.title: [718]Money Pouch Trading Method
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

I wouldn’t really know the actual code for this, here’s my explanation:

Open an interface which allows the input of numbers, like the “x” feature when banking etc, make the result add in money from the money pouch by looking at how the money pouch is used, e.g:
p.moneyPouch
Then make a check to see if the player has entered an amount higher than what he actually has, so something like this:

if(enteredamount >= p.moneyPouch)
       enteredamount = p.moneyPouch;

I’m not sure if it works like that though, would need someone good like sk8rdude461 to explain it in greater detail.

Read full topic
